result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew P Craney was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.
  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs - (Waupaca County consolidated count 15CF81), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Obtain and maintain full-time employment or be enrolled in and attend school full time, or a combination of both resulting in full time.

Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Use one (1) pharmacy to obtain prescriptions and disclose to agent and sign releases so agent can monitor prescription drug use and have access to pharmacy drug records and treating physician to determine compliance. 
Disclose any prescriptions prescribed and list to agent immediately.
No contact Colt Flynn (co-defendant), unless approved by the agent
Comply with any assessments, treatment, and programming as deemed appropriate by the Compas assessment and the Department of Corrections.
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.

Pay fines, costs, surcharges and Buy monies. If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

timeConds.notes: Huber for employment or counseling, treatment and education involved with and half in jail and second half on electronic or GPS monitoring if approved by jail and risk assessment. Report w/in 60 days and may served in Waupaca, Portage or Waushara county.

supervisions.notes: Pay costs + DNA surcharges.   Pay within 60 days or you will need to set up a payment plan. Payment plan enrollments are in person on Monday of each week.

Huber for employment or counseling, treatment and education involved with and half in jail and second half on electronic or GPS monitoring if approved by jail and risk assessment. Report w/in 60 days and may served in Waupaca, Portage or Waushara county.

Concurrent with: with Count 1

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Andrew P Craney in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

1:43 PM Court calls case.
Court states appearances.

Defendant wrote a letter, requesting contact with C.F., co-defendant from Waupaca County.

Court questions Defendant as to relationship between Defendant and C.F.
Defendant replies.

Atty Cousins addresses the Court, does not have a strong position.

BY THE COURT:
Court amends the JOC: No contact with C.F. unless approved by the agent. 

JOC to be forwarded to DOC.
Probation review hearing on October 17, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
(Corrected wording for Waupac County consolidated counts 3 thru 6)

8:40 a.m. Defendant Andrew P Craney in court with attorney Patrick Thomas Arendt. ADA Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court questions as to an amended information missing in the file.  Counts 1 & 3 were plead to and Count 3 is the Waupaca County consolidated charge.  Parties have received and reviewed the PSI Report.  ADA Cousins states minor corrections.
ADA Cousins makes sentencing arguments and requests probation. Ct 1 - W/H Sentence: 4yrs Probation w/conditions. Ct 2 - 1 yr jail w/some electronic monitoring and no objection to transfer to county of residence. Buy monies to be taken from bond at $150 and $160. $100 fine + costs + surcharges for each count. In agreement with conditions as recommended in the PSI on page 16.
Atty Arendt concurs with joint agreement and states count 1 has 5 days credit and 3 days credit on count 3. 
Defendant makes apologetic statements to the Court.
Court considers the factors as required by the law.

BTC:*********PROBATION*****
Count 1: 961.41(1)(d)1: Manufacture/Deliver Herion (<3g):
  W/H Sentence: 4 yrs Probation:
Conditions:
  Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.
  Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
 Use one (1) pharmacy to obtain prescriptions and disclose to agent and sign releases so agent can monitor prescription drug use and have access to pharmacy drug records and treating physician to determine compliance. Disclose any prescriptions prescribed and list to agent immediately.
NO contact C. F.
  AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
  Engage and comply in any other counseling reasonably related to the offense as recommended by the Agent and compas.  Obtain and maintain full-time employment or be enrolled in and attend school full time, or a combination of both resulting in full time.
  Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
  Submit DNA sample, if not already done so, and 
Pay $100 fine + costs + the DNA surcharge.
Buy money $310 cost is ordered.
Taken from the bond on file.
9 months jail huber for employment or counseling, treatment and education involved with and half in jail and second half on electronic or GPS monitoring if approved by jail and risk assessment. Report w/in 60 days and may served in Waupaca, Portage or Waushara county. 5 days credit

Count 3: 961.41(3g)(am): Possession of Narcotic Drugs - (consolidated Waupaca Co charge): 
1 yr jail, concurrent with count 1 w/same huber and conditions as Count 1.
Pay costs + DNA surcharges.
3 days credit

Appeal rights provided.
Parties keep their respective PSI reports and told they are confidential.

records.addlTxt: Petition to Consolidate with Waupaca County case 15CF81 and Copy of Consent to Consolidate from Waupaca County into Portage County case.

Defendant Andrew P Craney in court with attorney Patrick Thomas Arendt. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
8:48 a.m. Court calls the case. 

Atty Cousins states he is filing an amended information which contains the charges from Waupaca County.  The consolidation paperwork was filed with the Court yesterday he believes. 
Atty Arendt indicates he faxed the paperwork over yesterday. 
Court informs Atty Arendt of the fax procedure for Portage County. 
Atty Arendt files copies of the consolidation paperwork with the Court. 

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.
Atty Arendt received a copy of the amended information and waives its reading. 

Defendant enters a plea of:   15CF143 Counts 1 & 3  -  GUILTY

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).
Atty Arendt states the facts contained in the Waupaca County case (count 3). 

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty Counts 1 & 3.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Counts 2 and 4 - 6 are dismissed and read-in. 
Court orders a PSI. 
PSI to be completed by 12/16/15 with copies forwarded to the parties to prepare for sentencing arguments. 
Bond and conditions of bond are continued.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Andrew P Craney in court with attorney Patrick Thomas Arendt. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Andrew P Craney in court.  Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/Public Defender representation.
Defendant spoke to Atty Patrick Arendt.  Is not sure why he is not present.  He was appointed thru the public defender. 
Bailiff informs the Court he is in another courtroom.  
Court will recall this case. 

3:39 p.m.  Court recalls the case. 
Defendant Andrew P Craney in court with attorney Patrick Thomas Arendt. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for preliminary hearing to be held.

BY THE COURT:  Bond Continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
